function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Data collection involving phone interviews may lead to incomplete or biased information due to the absence of face-to-face interaction.","Impact":"Incomplete or biased data may lead to inaccurate conclusions and ineffective solutions to mitigate the spread of contagious diseases in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Use a combination of phone interviews and follow-up written surveys to verify and cross-check information. Incorporate diverse perspectives to mitigate bias.","Technologies":"Online survey tools for follow-up surveys and data verification.","People":"Contractors, researchers, public health officials","Owner":"Research team, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Sampling control may be ineffective, leading to a biased representation of contractors nationwide.","Impact":"Inaccurate representation of nationwide contractor perspectives may result in ineffective strategies for mitigating contagious disease propagation.","Mitigation":"Implement stratified sampling techniques to ensure representation from contractors of different sizes and geographic locations. Use random sampling within each stratum to mitigate bias.","Technologies":"Statistical software for stratified sampling and random sampling.","People":"Researchers, statisticians, public health officials","Owner":"Research team, public health organizations"},{"Description":"Limited sample size of 20 interviews may not capture the full range of perspectives and experiences in the construction industry.","Impact":"Inadequate sample size may result in oversights of critical insights and best practices for addressing contagious disease propagation in the built environment.","Mitigation":"Augment the interview data with secondary research, case studies, and expert opinions to provide a more comprehensive understanding.","Technologies":"Database search tools, literature review software, expert interview platforms.","People":"Researchers, industry experts, public health officials","Owner":"Research team, public health organizations"}]}
